metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25236 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high.
metadata.Description:
xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5 allows attackers to insert namespace-separator characters into namespace URIs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25236` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.5-2
libexpat1 - 2.4.5-2
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> paraview uses system expat xotcl uses system expat poco uses system expat gdcm uses system expat audacity uses system expat simgear uses system expat coin3 uses system expat as of 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-1 sitecopy uses system expat since 1:0.16.0-1 (dapper!) leosilva> pull request 577 adds relax fix to this CVE in regard RFC 3986 URI characters and fix also some regressions.

criterions.comment: cadaver package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
expat package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.5-2').
firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
wbxml2 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
